[{"category":["CDs & Vinyl","Jazz"],"description":["The release of the movie MILES AHEAD, Don Cheadle's wildly entertaining and moving exploration of Miles Davis, will be accompanied by this new soundtrack featuring musical highlights from Miles' career and new recordings overseen by Grammy Award-winning jazz\/hip-hop artist Robert Glasper.

This is a perfect primer on Davis' career for the new fan and a brilliant audio keepsake of the film for those who've studied his works inside and out. The album features 11 tracks from across Miles' catalogue from 1956 to 1981, select dialogue from the film featuring Cheadle in character, and five original compositions written, co-written, produced or performed exclusively for MILES AHEAD by Robert Glasper. These cues include "What's Wrong with That?" a jam that closes the movie imagining Cheadle as Miles playing in the present day with guest performers Glasper, Herbie Hancock, Wayne Shorter, Gary Clark, Jr. and Esperanza Spalding; plus "Gone 2015," an end-credits song featuring guest verses from rapper Pharoahe Monch. Cheadle also pens new liner notes for the album discussing the selection and creation of the songs on the soundtrack."],"title":"Miles Ahead Soundtrack","brand":"Miles Davis","rank":"107,843 in CDs & Vinyl (","asin":"B01BW5B29Y","imageURLHighRes":["https:\/\/images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com\/images\/I\/51z0SUFmlVL.jpg"],"details":{"Audio CD":"(April 1, 2016)","Original Release Date:":"April 1, 2016","Number of Discs:":"1","Label:":"Sony Legacy","Run Time:":"76 minutes","ASIN:":"B01BW5B29Y"}}]

[{"category":["CDs & Vinyl","Jazz"],"description":["Born in Chicago in 1935, Ramsey Emmanuel Lewis Jr., was already taking piano lessons at the age of four. At 15 he joined his first jazz band, The Cleffs, and later formed the Ramsey Lewis Trio with two other members, drummer Isaac ""Redd"" Holt and bassist Eldee Young. The Trio would go on to record 25 albums together by which time, the mid 1960s, they were not just one of the hottest Jazz outfits in the USA but were equally known on the pop charts as crossover singles such as 'Wade In The Water', 'The In Crowd' and 'Hang On Sloopy' all went top 10. Young and Holt left Ramsey around this time to form their own Young Holt Unlimited, while Lewis continued to bring in superlative jazz men such as drummer\/vocalist Maurice White (later to form Earth, Wind and Fire) to back him on numerous further records, film soundtracks and in performance. This compilation features Ramsey Lewis' complete recorded output from his first album, 1956's Ramsey Lewis & His Gentle-men of Swing, through to 1960 and An Hour with the Ramsey Lewis Trio. The selection here includes eight complete albums originally released through this golden age for Jazz in general, and Ramsey Lewis in particular, including as it does collaborations with other jazz giants such as Jimmy Woods, Max Roach and Lorez Alexandria."],"title":"Complete Recordings: 1957-1960","brand":"Ramsey Lewis","rank":"223,739 in CDs & Vinyl (","asin":"B00IC13TMK","imageURLHighRes":["https:\/\/images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com\/images\/I\/51fOBfb4dxL.jpg"],"details":{"Audio CD":"(May 6, 2014)","Original Release Date:":"May 6, 2014","Number of Discs:":"4","Label:":"Enlightenment","ASIN:":"B00IC13TMK"}}]

[{"category":["CDs & Vinyl","Jazz"],"description":["There is nothing more romantic than the sensual sounds of the tenor sax. This recording presents those sounds performed by master saxophonist, Denis Solee, backed by lush string orchestration. Top that off with all-time classic standards including \"My Romance\", \"Georgia on My Mind\", and \"When I Fall in Love\", and you have the perfect recording for intimate moments with the one you love.","Master of saxophones, flute, and clarinet, Denis Solee's career includes playing on hundreds of recordings, commercials, TV shows, and film scores. His long list of recording credits includes projects by major artists including Chet Atkins, Garth Brooks, Bela Fleck, Amy Grant, Michael McDonald, Roy Orbison, and many more. Denis has appeared in concert with Natalie Cole, Sammy Davis Jr., Marvin Hamlisch, Bob Hope, Liza Minnelli, Mel Torme, and a vast group of others."],"title":"Sax And Romance","brand":"Denis Solee","rank":"55,244 in CDs & Vinyl (","asin":"B0001GUQNO","imageURLHighRes":["https:\/\/images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com\/images\/I\/61ufJBq%2BHDL.jpg"],"details":{"Audio CD":"(August 18, 2008)","Original Release Date:":"January 7, 1998","Number of Discs:":"1","Label:":"Spring Hill","ASIN:":"B0001GUQNO"}},{"category":["CDs & Vinyl","Jazz"],"description":["There is nothing more romantic than the sensual sounds of the tenor sax. Top that off with all-time classic standards including \"My Romance\", \"Georgia on My Mind\", and \"When I Fall in Love\", and you have the perfect recording for intimate moments with the one you love.","Master of saxophones, flute, and clarinet, Denis Solee's career includes playing on hundreds of recordings, commercials, TV shows, and film scores. His long list of recording credits includes projects by major artists including Chet Atkins, Garth Brooks, Bela Fleck, Amy Grant, Michael McDonald, Roy Orbison, and many more. Denis has appeared in concert with Natalie Cole, Sammy Davis Jr., Marvin Hamlisch, Bob Hope, Liza Minnelli, Mel Torme, and a vast group of others."],"title":"Sax And Romance","brand":"Denis Solee","rank":"55,244 in CDs & Vinyl (","asin":"B0001GUQNO","imageURLHighRes":["https:\/\/images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com\/images\/I\/61ufJBq%2BHDL.jpg"],"details":{"Audio CD":"(August 18, 2008)","Original Release Date:":"January 7, 1998","Number of Discs:":"1","Label:":"Spring Hill","ASIN:":"B0001GUQNO"}}]
